attributes.action: To debate the right of the media to disclose the HIV status of an individual.
attributes.background:
Former rugby player Gareth Thomas has said a journalist spoke to his parents about his HIV status before they had discussed it.

He said he would "absolutely not" have made his diagnosis public if a tabloid had not made threats to publish it.

rejection.details:
Complaints about the press are the responsibility of the Independent Press Standards Organisation (IPSO), not the Government or Parliament.  

You can find out how to make a complaint to IPSO here: 

https://www.ipso.co.uk/IPSO/makeacomplaint.html
